message:
Restrict public access to S3 buckets (AWS Security Best Practices): Ensure that S3 buckets are not publicly accessible. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev-retired/access-control-block-public-access.html

Enable S3 bucket versioning (CIS AWS Foundations): Enable versioning for all S3 buckets. URL: https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf

Enable server access logging for S3 buckets (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Enable access logging to track activity on S3 buckets. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ServerLogs.html

Enable S3 bucket encryption with AWS Key Management Service (AWS Security Best Practices): Use AWS KMS to manage encryption keys for S3 buckets. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingKMSEncryption.html

Implement Object Lock for S3 buckets (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Use Object Lock to prevent objects from being deleted or modified for a specified retention period. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/object-lock.html

Configure S3 bucket versioning to require MFA for deletion (CIS AWS Foundations): Enable versioning and require multi-factor authentication to delete S3 bucket versions. URL: https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf

Enforce secure transport (HTTPS) for S3 bucket (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Configure S3 bucket policies to require secure (HTTPS) connections. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/example-bucket-policies.html#example-bucket-policies-use-case-3

Enable S3 bucket access logging (AWS Security Best Practices): Enable logging of S3 bucket access using AWS CloudTrail. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/enable-logging.html

Implement VPC endpoint for S3 (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Use VPC endpoints to ensure direct communication between VPC resources and S3 without going through the internet gateway. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/vpc-endpoints-s3.html

Enable S3 bucket event notifications (AWS Security Best Practices): Configure event notifications to trigger actions for specific S3 bucket events. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/NotificationHowTo.html

List security controls for Amazon S3 based on guidelines from CIS, NIST, AWS Security Best Practices, and STIGs. Use direct imperative commands, focusing on access management, encryption, monitoring, and network controls. For each control, include the specific source and a URL for direct access to additional details. Omit introductions, conclusions, comments, and warnings about content limitations.

Examples:

Implement the principle of least privilege for IAM permissions (AWS Security Best Practices): Ensure IAM policies for S3 are restricted to necessary operations. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/best-practices.html

Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for object deletion (CIS AWS Foundations): Require multi-factor authentication to delete objects. URL: https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf

Enable server-side encryption for all objects stored in S3 (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Use AWS S3 SSE to protect data at rest. URL: https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf

Use policies to enforce encryption on upload (AWS Security Best Practices): Configure bucket policies to reject unencrypted object uploads. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/using-iam-policies.html
